src: تأكد من استرخاء يدك قد ما تقدر مع الاستمرار في ضرب كل النغمات بشكل صحيح - حاول كذلك عدم القيام بحركاتٍ غريبةٍ بأصابعك. لن تبذل مجهوداً كبيراً إذا اتبعت تلك الطريقة. تذكر انه مو لازم تضغط على المفاتيح بقوةٍ كبيرةٍ لتحصل على مستوى صوتٍ أعلى كما في البيانو. في الأكورديون، للحصول على صوت أعلى إضافي، تقدر استخدام المنفاخ بمزيد من الضغط أو السرعة.
mt: Make sure to relax your hand as much as you can while continuing to strike the correct notes - try also not to make any strange movements with your fingers. You won't put much effort if you follow this method. Remember that you don't have to press the keys very hard to get a higher sound as in the piano. In the accordion, to get an additional higher sound, you can use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: من المشاكل الشائعة عند محاولة تحويل فيلم إلى تنسيق DVD هو المسح الضوئي الزائد. تصنع معظم أجهزة التلفزيون بطريقة ترضي عامة الجمهور. علشان كذا، تجد كل شيء تراه على شاشة التلفاز مقطوع الحواف، من الأعلى والأسفل و الجانبين. تم عمل ذلك للتأكد من أن الصورة تغطي الشاشة بأكملها. هذا يُسمى بالتجزئة العالية. لسوء الحظ، من المرجح أن يتم قطع حدود قرص DVD عند إنشاؤه، وإذا كان الفيديو يحتوي على ترجمات قريبة جداً من الجزء السفلي، فلن يتم عرضها بالكامل.
mt: 1. A common problem when trying to convert a film to a DVD format is the excessive edge bleed. Most televisions are made to satisfy the general public. Therefore, you will find everything you see on the TV screen cut off at the top, bottom, and sides. This is done to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. This is called high cropping. Unfortunately, the edges of a DVD disc are likely to be cut off when it is created, and if the video contains subtitles very close to the bottom, they will not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: اعتمدت الخطة الأمريكية على شن هجمات منظمة من ثلاثة اتجاهات مختلفة. يمكن للجنرال جون كادوالادر شن هجوم لتشتيت الانتباه ضد الحامية البريطانية في بوردينتاون لمنع أي تعزيزات. سيأخذ الجنرال جيمس أوينج 700 من عناصر المليشيا عبر النهر في عبارة ترينتون، ويستولي على الجسر فوق خليج أسونبينك، وسيمنع أي قوات معادية من الهروب. كانت قوّة الهجوم الرئيسيّة، المكوّنة من 2,400 رجلاً، ستعبر النهر الواقع على بعد تسعة أميال شمال ترينتون، ثم تنقسم إلى مجموعتين، الأولى بقيادة غرين والثانية بقيادة سوليفان، من أجل إطلاق هجوم قبل الفجر.
mt: The American plan was to launch a three-pronged attack. General John Cadwalader would lead a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown to prevent any reinforcements. General James Ogden would take 700 militia across the river in the ferry Trintown, seize the bridge over Asunpink Creek, and prevent any enemy from escaping. The main force, consisting of 2,400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, then split into two groups, one led by Greene and the other by Sullivan, to launch a predawn attack.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "بعد تبنيه من قبل الكونغرس في 4 تموز، أُرسلت مسودةٌ مكتوبةٌ بخط اليد وقعها رئيس الكونغرس جون هانكوك وأمين السر تشارلز طومسون على بعد البعض من الأبنية إلى مطبعة جون دونلاب. وخلال الليل تم عمل ما بين 150 و200 نسخة، تعرف الآن باسم ""نشرات دونلاب النقدية"". كانت أول قراءة عامة للوثيقة بواسطة جون نيكسون في باحة قاعة الاستقلال في الثامن من رجب. أُرسلت واحدة منهم إلى جورج واشنطن في السادس من رجب، وقد قرأها على قوّاته في نيويورك في التاسع من رجب. ووصلت نسخة منها إلى لندن في العاشر من شعبان. تمثل مطويات دونلاب الخمس والعشرون أقدم النسخ الباقية من مستند إعلان الاستقلال الأمريكي، ولكن النسخة الأصلية المكتوبة بخط اليد لم يُكتب لها النجاة."
mt: "After its passage by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by President John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was sent to the John Dunlap print shop. During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as the Dunlap Broadside. The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the rotunda of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington in New York on July 6, and he read it to his troops on July 9. A copy was sent to London on July 10. The Dunlap Broadsides are the twenty-fifth oldest surviving copies of the United States Declaration of Independence, but the original handwritten draft did not survive."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: وطالب المستعمرون، الذين شاهدوا هذا النشاط، بتعزيزات. ضمّت تعزيزات المواقع الأمامية كتيبتي نيوهامبشير الأولى والثالثة في صفوفهما 200 من الرجال يقودهم العقيد چون ستارك والعقيد چيمس ريد (والذين أصبحا بعدها جنرالين). تمركز رجال ستارك في مواقع بطول السياج من الطرف الشمالي لمكان المستعمر. عندما فتح المدّ المنخفض فجوة على طول النهر الغامض على طول الجانب الشمالي الشرقي من شبه الجزيرة، مدّوا السياج سريعاً بجدار حجري قصير إلى الشمال ينتهي عند حافة المياه على شاطئ صغير. وضع جريدلي أو ستارك وتدًا على بعد حوالي 100 قدم (30 مترًا) أمام السياج وأمر ألا يطلق أحد النار حتى يعبره ضباط الجيش.
mt: The settlers, who witnessed this activity, requested reinforcements.  Reinforcements to the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments, each with 200 men led by Colonel John Stark and Colonel James Reed (who later became generals).  Stark's men were positioned in a line along the northern side of the settlement.  When the low gate opened a gap along the mysterious river on the northeast side of the peninsula, they quickly extended the wall with a short stone wall to the north, ending at the water's edge on a small beach.  O'Sullivan or Stark placed a palisade and abatis about 100 feet (30 meters) in front of the wall and ordered no one to fire until the officers crossed it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: كان لدى الصين القديمة طريقةٌ فريدةٌ لعرض الفترات الزمنية المختلفة؛ كانت كل مرحلة من مراحل الصين أو كل أسرة كانت في السلطة من نوعٍ مختلفٍ. بالإضافة إلى ذلك، كان هناك بين كل سلالة حاكمة عصرٌ غير مستقرٍ من المقاطعات المقسمة. أشهر هذه الفترات كانت حقبة الممالك الثلاث التي دامت 60 عاماً بين أسرة هان وسلالة جين. نشأت خلال هذه الفترات حرب شرسة بين العديد من النبلاء سعيًا إلى العرش. حقبة الممالك الثلاثة هي واحدة من أكثر الحقب دمويةً في تاريخ الصين القديمة مات آلاف من الناس خلال القتال في سبيل الجلوس على أعلى المقاعد في القصر الكبير في شيان.
mt: The Chinese had a unique way of showing different time periods; each dynasty or ruling family was of a different type. In addition, there was an unstable period between each ruling dynasty of divided provinces. The most famous of these periods was the Three Kingdoms era, which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this period, there was a fierce war between many nobles seeking the throne. The Three Kingdoms era is one of the most bloody periods in the history of ancient China, with thousands of people dying in the fight for the highest seats in the Great Palace in Xian.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: تسير مستعمرات النمل المجند وتعشش في مراحل مختلفة أيضاً. في مرحلة التنقّل، تسير جيوش النمل في الليل، وتتوقّف للعسكرة أثناء النهار. تبدأ المستعمرة في مرحلة الترحال عندما يقل الغذاء المتاح. خلال هذه المرحلة، تقوم المستعمرة بعمل أعشاش مؤقتة تتغير كل يوم. استمرت كل من هذه الاقتحامات أو المسيرات التي يقوم بها البدو الرُحل لمدة 17 يومًا تقريبًا.
mt: Ant colonies and nests also go through different stages. In the foraging stage, ant armies march at night and stop to nest during the day. The colony begins the trekking stage when food is scarce. During this stage, the colony makes temporary nests that change every day. These raids or marches by nomadic Bedouins lasted about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: يعتمد كثير من الإيقاعات المرصودة في علم وظائف الأعضاء والسلوك بشكل حاسم في كثير من الأحيان على وجود دورات ذاتية وإنتاجها من خلال الساعات البيولوجية. تم توثيق الإيقاعات الدورية، اللي مو مجرد استجابات للإشارات الدورية الخارجية، لمعظم الكائنات الحية، بما في ذلك الخاصة بالبكتيريا والفطريات والنباتات والحيوانات. الساعات البيولوجية هي متذبذبات ذاتية ستستمر لفترات من الدورات المتتابعة حتى في حالة عدم وجود مؤثراتٍ خارجية.
mt: Many of the circadian rhythms observed in physiology and behavior are critically dependent on the presence of self-sustaining oscillations and their generation through biological clocks. Circadian rhythms, which are not merely responses to external periodic stimuli, have been documented in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillations that persist for periods of several cycles in the absence of external influences.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: "السكان هو مجموعة الكائنات الحية من نوع معين داخل منطقة جغرافية معينة. عندما يكون جميع الأفراد في فئة سكانية متطابقين فيما يتعلق بسمة ظاهرية معينة، فيطلق على هؤلاء الأفراد مسمى ""أحاديو الشكل"". عندما يُظهر الأفراد بضعة متغيرات لسمة محددة، فهُم متعددو الأشكال."
mt: "A population is a group of individuals of the same species living within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with respect to a particular phenotypic trait, they are said to be monomorphic. When individuals in a population exhibit a few variants of a particular trait, they are said to be polymorphic."
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

mt: Natural tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including the flora and fauna. src: يُغادر الناس المدن الصغيرة في سياراتهم في كل صباح ليذهبوا إلى أماكن عملهم ويقابلهم في الطريق الآخرون العاملون في المكان الذي غادروه للتو. في وسيلة النقل المفعمة بالحيويّة هذه، كل واحد يدعم ويرتبط نوعاً ما بمنظومة نقل أساسها السيّارات الخاصّة. يشير العلم الآن إلى أن هذا الاقتصاد الضخم المعتمد على الكربون قد أزاح المحيط الحيوي من إحدى حالاته المستقرة اللي دعمت التطور البشري على مدى المليوني سنةٍ الماضية.
mt: People leave small towns in their cars every morning to go to their jobs and meet others on the way who work in the place they just left. In this lively means of transport, each one supports and is somehow linked to a system of transport based on private cars. Science now points out that this large carbon-based economy has pushed the living ocean from one of its stable states that supported human evolution over the past million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: تعتمد جميعُ أجهزة الحاسوبِ المستخدمة اليوم افتراضياً على معالجة المعلومات المشفرة في شكل أرقامٍ ثُنائية. يمكن أن تكون قيمة الرقم الثنائي قيمة واحدة فقط من قيمتين، وهما 0 أو 1، ويُشار إلى هذه الأرقام على أنها أرقام ثنائية - أو بتّات، إذا استخدمنا لغة الحاسوب الاصطلاحية.
mt: All computers used today are based on processing binary information in the form of two-valued numbers. A binary number can have only one value out of two, 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as bits, if we use the computer jargon.

src: "كما يمكن للمدونات المساعدة في تحسين كتابة الطلاب. في حين يبدأ الطلاب في الأغلب تجربتهم في المدونات بقواعد نحوية وإملائية غير متقنة، فإن وجود جمهور يغير ذلك بشكل عام. وبما أن الطلاب هم الجمهور الأكثر انتقاداً في أغلب الأحيان، فإن كاتب المدونة يبدأ في السعي لتحسين الكتابة لتجنب الانتقاد. كما أن المدونات ""ترغم الطّلاب على أن يصبحوا أكثر ذكاء حول العالم من حولهم"". إن الحاجة إلى تغذية اهتمام الجمهور تلهم الطلاب على أن يكونوا بارعين ومفيدين (توتو، 2004). التدوين هو أداة تلهم التعاون وتشجع الطلاب على توسيع نطاق التعلم إلى ما بعد اليوم الدراسي التقليدي. إن الاستخدام المناسب للمدونات يمكن ""أن يمكن الطلاب من أن يصبحوا أكثر تحليلاً ونقداً؛ ومن خلال الاستجابة الفعّالة للمواد على شبكة الإنترنت، يمكن للطلاب تحديد مواقفهم في سياق كتابات الآخرين بالإضافة إلى تحديد آرائهم الخاصة بشأن قضايا معينة (أورافيك، 2002)."
mt: "As blogs can help improve student writing. While students typically begin their blogging experiences with poor grammar and spelling, having an audience often changes that. And since students are often the most critical audience, the blogger begins to strive to improve his or her writing to avoid criticism. As the need to feed the audience's interest inspires students to be better and more helpful (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration and encourages students to extend their learning beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs can ""enable students to become more analytical and critical; by responding effectively to materials on the Internet, students can identify their positions in the context of others' writings as well as identify their own positions on certain issues (Orravik, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: يحفّز الاتصال غير المتزامن لتخصيص الوقت للتأمل والتفاعل تجاه الآخرين. يتيح للطلاب القدرة على العمل وفقاً لسرعتهم الخاصة والتحكم في وتيرة المعلومات التعليمية. علاوة على ذلك، يوجد قيود زمنية أقل مع إمكانية تحديد ساعات عمل مرنة. (بريمر، 1998) يتيح استخدام الإنترنت والشبكة العنكبوتية العالمية للمتعلمين الوصول إلى المعلومات في أي وقت. يمكن للطلاب أيضاً إرسال أسئلة إلى المدرسين في أي وقت من اليوم وتوقع إجابات سريعة بشكل معقول، بدلاً من الانتظار حتى الاجتماع التالي وجهاً لوجه.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for time to reflect and interact with others. It allows students to work at their own pace and control the pace of the educational information. In addition, there are fewer time constraints with the ability to set flexible work hours. (Pimmer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to access information at any time. Students can also send questions to instructors at any time of the day and expect reasonable quick answers, instead of waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: ألهمت القلعة التقليدية من العصور الوسطى الخيال منذ فترة طويلة، مكونةً صوراً للمبارزات، والولائم، وفروسية الملك آرثر. وحتى لو كنت واقفاً وسط آثار عمرها ألف سنة، فمن السهل أن يحضر في ذهنك أصوات وروائح المعارك التي مرت منذ فترةٍ طويلةٍ، وأن تسمع تقريباً صوت الثرثرة على القلنسوة على الحصى وأن نشم رائحة الخوف الذي يتصاعد من حفر الزنزانة. لكن هل مخيلتنا مبنية على الواقع؟ لماذا بُنِيَت القلاع في الأصل؟ كيف تم تصميمها وبناؤها؟
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired fantasy, creating images of knights, feasts, and King Arthur's chivalry. Even if you're standing amid a thousand-year-old ruin, it's easy to conjure up the sounds and smells of battles long past, to hear the clanking of armor on the pebbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: "تعد قلعة ""كيربي موكسلو""، نموذجية لهذه الفترة، فهي منزلاً محصناً أكثر من كونها قلعة حقيقية. نوافذها الكبيرة المصقولة وأسوارها الرقيقة لم تكن لتقاوم هجوماً حازماً لفترة طويلة. في ثمانينيات القرن الرابع عشر 884ه، عندما بدأ اللورد هاستينجز في بنائه، كانت البلاد هادئة نسبيًا وكان الدفاع مطلوبًا فقط ضد مجموعات صغيرة من اللصوص المتجولين."
mt: "Kirby Muxloe Castle is typical of its period, being more a fortified manor house than a true castle. Its large, cusped windows and thin walls would not have withstood a determined assault for long. In the 884s, when Lord Hastings began building it, the country was relatively peaceful and defence was only required against small bands of wandering outlaws."
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: مع التغيير في مسافة السباق من ربع ميل إلى نصف ميل تُصبح السرعة أقل أهمية بكثير وتصبح القدرة على التحمل ضرورة مطلقة. بالطبع عداء سباقات النصف ميل من الدرجة الأولى، رجل يمكنه فعل ذلك في أقل من دقيقتين، يجب أن يتمتع بقدر معقول من السرعة، ولكن يجب صقل القدرة على التحمل في جميع الأحوال. يعبر البعض البلد جرياً خلال فصل الشتاء، جنباً إلى جنب مع التمارين الرياضية للجزء العلوي من الجسم، هو أفضل إعداد لموسم الجري.
mt: With the change in the race distance from quarter mile to half mile, speed becomes much less important and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course, a top half-mile runner, a man who can do it in less than two minutes, must have a reasonable amount of speed, but he must also have a well-developed endurance. Some people run the country during the winter, along with upper-body exercise, is the best preparation for a running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: "يعتمد التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي على ظاهرة فيزيائية تسمى الرنين المغناطيسي النووي (NMR)، واللي اكتشفت في ثلاثينيات القرن الماضي عن طريق فيليكس بلوخ (من جامعة ستانفورد) وإدوارد بورسيل (من جامعة هارفارد). في هذا الرنين، تتسبب المجالات المغناطيسيّة والموجات الراديويّة في حث الذرّات على إرسال إشارات لاسلكية دقيقة. في عام 1390ه، اكتشف رايموند داماديان، وهو طبيب وعالم أبحاث، الأساس الذي بُني عليه استخدام التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي كأداة للتشخيص الطبّي. بعد أريع سنوات، تم منح براءة اختراع، واللي كانت أول براءة اختراع في العالم يتم منحها في مجال التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي. في عام 1397ه استكمل الدكتور داماديان إنشاء أول ماسح ضوئي للتصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي ""لكامل الجسم""، واللي يسمى اليوم ب""الذي لا يقهر""."
mt: "Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (of Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (of Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic fields and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1390, Raymond Damadian, a physician and researcher, discovered the basis for using MRI as a medical diagnostic tool. After a few years, a patent was granted, which was the first patent in the world to be granted in the field of MRI. In 1397, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first "whole-body" MRI scanner, which is now called "the invincible". "
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: الإنسان هو أكثر الكائنات موهبةً في قراءة عقول الآخرين. يعني ذلك أننا قادرون على التنبؤ بشكل ناجح بمنظور البشر الآخرين أو نواياهم أو إيمانهم أو معرفتهم أو رغبتهم. من بين هذه القدرات، فهم نية الآخرين فهو أمرٌ بالغُ الأهمية. حيث يسمح لنا بتحليل الغموض المحتمل في الأفعال الجسدية. على سبيل المثال، إذا رأيت شخصاً يكسر نافذة سيارة، فمن المحتمل أن تفترض أنه كان يحاول سرقة سيارة شخص غريب. ويمكن الحكم عليه بشكل مختلف إذا فقد مفاتيح سيارته وكانت سيارته هي التي يحاول اقتحامها.
mt: Humans are the most talented in reading other minds. This means that we can successfully predict other people's perspectives, intentions, beliefs, knowledge, or desires. Among these abilities, understanding other people's intentions is of great importance. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you may assume that he was trying to steal a stranger's car. It can be judged differently if he lost the keys to his car and was trying to break into his own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

mt: Despite its strong association with science fiction, artificial intelligence is a very important branch of computer science, dealing with intelligent behavior, learning, and adaptation of machines. AI research is divided into subfields that include methods by which machines themselves can learn to solve problems through experience and reasoning, and methods by which people can teach machines to behave in an intelligent way. Current research is increasingly concerned with discovering or analyzing the characteristics of intelligence and developing and implementing artificial systems that display them. AI is also concerned with the question of whether machines can actually think, and whether they can do so in the same sense that humans can. AI research is also motivated by the desire to understand human minds by discovering how they perform and implement cognitive and intellectual tasks. src: أنماط التفكير التجميعي هي أساليب لحل المشاكل تجمع أفكار أو مجالات مختلفة لإيجاد حل. تركز هذه العقلية على السرعة والمنطق والدقة وأيضاً على تحديد الحقائق وإعادة تطبيق التقنيات الموجودة وجمع المعلومات. والعامل الأكثر أهمية في هذه العقلية هو: لا توجد سوى إجابة واحدة صحيحة. لا تفكر إلا في إجابتين، وهما إجابة صحيحة أو خاطئة. يَرْتبط هذا النوع من التفكير بعلمٍ معين أو إجراءاتٍ قياسيةٍ. فالأشخاص اللي عندهم هذا النوع من التفكير عندهم تفكير منطقي وهم قادرون على حفظ الأنماط وحل المشاكل والعمل على الاختبارات العلمية.
mt: Pattern thinking is a way of solving problems that brings together ideas or different fields to find a solution. This mindset focuses on speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as identifying facts and reapplying existing techniques and gathering information. The most important factor in this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. Do not think of more than two answers, one correct or incorrect. This type of thinking is associated with a particular science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking and are able to remember patterns, solve problems, and work on scientific tests.

src: أدى استخدام تسجيلات الفيديو إلى اكتشافات هامة في مجال تفسير التعابير الدقيقة للوجه، وهي حركات للوجه تستمر لبضع أجزاء من الثانية الواحدة. ويُدّعى على وجه الخصوص أن المرء يستطيع أن يكتشف ما إذا كان الشخص يكذب من خلال تفسير التعبيرات الدقيقة بشكل صحيح. وقد أشارَ أوليفر ساكس في ورقته إلى أنّ خطاب الرّئيس يشير إلى أنّ الأشخاص غير القادرين على فهم الكلام بسبب تلفِ الدّماغ يكونون قادرين على تقييم الصّدق بدقةٍ. بل إنه يطرح فكرة أن تكون هذه القدرات في تحليل السلوك البشري مشتركة مع بعض الحيوانات، مثل الكلاب الأليفة.
mt: The use of video recordings has led to important discoveries in the field of interpreting the subtle expressions of the face, which are facial movements that last for a few seconds at a time. It is claimed in particular that one can detect whether a person is lying by correctly interpreting the subtle expressions. Oliver Sacks' paper points out that the president's speech indicates that people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage are able to assess truthfulness accurately. He even suggests that these abilities in human behavioral analysis are shared with some animals, such as pet dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: بينما أصبحت القدرة على اقتناء المعرفة والتعلم متغيرة بالطريقة المذكورة أعلاه، فإن المعدل الأساسي لاقتناء المعرفة قد تغير. وسيلة الحصول علي المعلومات كانت مختلفة. ما عاد الضغط يتمثل في التذكر الفردي، لكن القدرة على تذكر النص حصلت علي التركيز الأكبر. وفي جوهر الأمر، أحدث عصر النهضة تغييراً كبيراً في نهج التعلم ونشر المعرفة.
mt: While the ability to acquire knowledge and learning has changed in the way described above, the basic rate of acquiring knowledge has changed. The way of obtaining information was different. No longer is the pressure to be individual recall, but the ability to recall the text has received the greatest focus. In essence, the Renaissance brought about a major change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "يجمع الإنترنت بين عناصر كلٍّ من التواصل الجماهيري والشخصي. تؤدي الخصائص المميزة للإنترنت إلى أبعاد إضافية من حيث نهج الاستخدامات وطرق الإشباع. فعلى سبيل المثال، يقترح البعض ""التعلم"" و""التنشئة الاجتماعية"" كدوافع مهمّة لاستخدام شبكة الإنترنت (جيمس وغيره، 1995). تم التعرف على ""المشاركة الشخصية"" و ""العلاقات المستمرة"" كجوانب تحفيزية جديدة بواسطة إيمي ومكورد (1998) عندما درسوا رد فعل الجمهور على مواقع الويب."
mt: "The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The unique characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of usage patterns and gratifications. For example, some have suggested "learning" and "socialization" as important motives for Internet use (James et al., 1995). "Personal involvement" and "continuing relationships" were identified as new motivators by Amy and McKenna (1998) when they studied the public's reaction to web sites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: بلغ الطراز القوطي ذروته في فترة ما بين القرنين العاشر أو الحادي عشر إلى القرن الرابع عشر. في البداية، أثرت الثقافة البيزنطية في الشرق على الملابس تأثيرًا شديدًا. وعلى الرغم من ذلك، فنظرا لبطء قنوات التواصل، قد تتأخر الأنماط في الغرب قدر ما يقارب 25 إلى 30 سنة. في نهاية العصور الوسطى، بدأت أوروبا الغربية في تطوير أسلوبها الخاص. واحدة من أكبر التطورات في ذلك الوقت نتيجة للحروب الصليبية بدأ الناس في استخدام الأزرار لربط الملابس.
mt: Gothic fashion reached its peak between the 10th or 11th and 14th centuries. In the beginning, Byzantine culture had a strong influence on clothing in the East. However, due to the slow communication channels, the styles in the West could lag behind by about 25 to 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. One of the biggest developments at that time was the result of the Crusades, people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: يمكننا أن نبدأ في العيش بشكل أكثر تناسباً مع البيئة، ويمكننا الانضمام إلى الحركة البيئية، ويمكننا حتى أن نكون نشطاء من أجل تقليل المعاناة المستقبلية بدرجة ما. هذا هو تماماً مثل علاج الأعراض في كثير من الحالات. ومع ذلك، إذا كنا لا نريد حلاً مؤقتاً فقط، فعلينا أن نجد جذر المشكلات، ويجب علينا إنهائها. إنه من الواضح بشكل كاف أن العالم تغير كثيراً بسبب التقدم العلمي والتقنية للبشرية، وأصبحت المشاكل أكبر بسبب زيادة السكان ونمط الحياة المترف للإنسان.
mt: We can start living more in harmony with the environment, we can join the environmental movement, and we can even be active in reducing future suffering to some degree. This is just like treating symptoms in many cases. However, if we don't want a temporary solution only, we must find the root of the problems, and we must end them. It is clear enough that the world has changed a lot due to human scientific and technological progress, and the problems have become bigger because of the increase in population and the affluent lifestyle of man.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: كانت الموازنة في الطاقة نظاماً حاولت من خلاله الدول الأوروبية أن تُحافظ على السيادة الوطنية الخاصة بجميع الدول الأوروبية. نص المفهوم على أن جميع الدول الأوروبية يجب أن تسعى لمنع دولة واحدة من أن تصبح قوية، وبالتالي عادةً ما غيرت الحكومات الوطنية تحالفاتها للحفاظ على التوازن. كانت حرب الخلافة الإسبانية هي الحرب الأولى التي كانت قضيتها المركزية هي ميزان القوى. كان ذلك بمثابةِ تغييرٍ مهمٍ، حيث لم يعد لدى القوى الأوروبية ذريعة لكونها حروباً دينية. وهكذا، ستكون حرب الثلاثين عاماً آخر حربٍ توصف بأنها حرب دينية.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system that the European countries tried to use to maintain the national sovereignty of all European countries. The concept was that all European countries should try to prevent one country from becoming too powerful, and thus, national governments often changed alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war whose central issue was the Balance of Power. This was a major change, as the European powers no longer had a pretext for being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be another war described as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: خضعت الكنيسة الكاثوليكية، اللي أصبحت غنية وقوية، للتدقيق خلال هذه الفترة من التاريخ الأوروبي. ربطت الديانة المسيحية الدول الأوروبية معًا لأكثر من ألف عام على الرغم من الاختلافات في اللغة والعادات. إن القوة الشاملة التي امتلكتها أثّرت على الجميع بدءاً من الملك وحتى الناس العاديين. من بين المبادئ المسيحية الرئيسية أن الثروة لابد وأن تُستخدم لتخفيف المعاناة والفقر، وأن الأموال النقدية للكنيسة موجودة بشكل خاص لهذا السبب. كانت السلطة المركزية للكنيسة في روما لأكثر من ألف عام، وقد أدى هذا التركيز للسلطة والمال إلى تساؤل الكثيرين عن مدى الوفاء بمتطلبات العقيدة.
mt: The Catholic Church, which became rich and powerful, underwent scrutiny during this period of European history. Christianity tied the European nations together for more than a thousand years despite differences in language and customs. Its overarching power affected everyone from the king to the common man. Among the main tenets of Christianity is that wealth must be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that the Church's monetary resources are there specifically for this purpose. The central authority of the Church in Rome was for more than a thousand years, and this concentration of power and money led many to question how well the doctrine was being followed.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: مرعوبين، أُجبر الملك لويس السادس عشر والملكة ماري أنطوانيت وطفلاهما الصغيران (ماري تيريز ذات الـ11 عاماً ولويس تشارلز ذو الأربع أعوام) وأخت الملك، السيدة إليزابيث، في السابع عشر من محرم عام 1204ه، على الرجوع من فرساي إلى باريس بواسطة حشد من غوغاء نسوة السوق. سافروا عودةً إلى باريس في عربة يحيط بهم حشد كبير من الناس الذين يصرخون ويهتفون ضد الملك والملكة. تمكنت مجموعة من الجماهير من إجبار الملك والملكة على فتح نوافذ عربتهم على مصراعيها. قام أحد أفراد العصابة في وقت ما بالتلويح برأس أحد أفراد الحرس الملكي المقتولين في فرساي أمام الملكة المذعورة.
mt: Shocked, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette and their two young children (11-year-old Marie Therese and 4-year-old Louis Charles) and the king's sister, Princess Elizabeth, were forced to return from Versailles to Paris by a mob of market women. They returned to Paris in a cart surrounded by a large crowd of people who were shouting and chanting against the king and queen. A mob at one point forced the king and queen to open the windows of their cart. At one point, one of the mob waved the head of one of the slain royal guards before the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: سرعان ما بادرت بريطانيا بمحاصرة ألمانيا بحرًيا بعد اندلاع المناوشات. أثبتت الإستراتيجية فاعليتها؛ قطع الإمدادات الحيوية العسكرية والمدنية، على الرغم من انتهاك هذا الحصار للقانون الدولي المقبول بشكل عام والذي دُوّن ونُسّق في عدة اتفاقيات دولية خلال القرنين الماضيين. فقد لغمت بريطانيا المياه الدولية لمنع أي سفينة من دخول قطاعاتٍ كاملةٍ من المحيطات، الأمر الذي يهدد حتى السفن المحايدة. بسبب وجود استجابة محدودة لهذا التكتيك، توقعت ألمانيا رداً مشابهاً على حرب الغواصات غير المقيدة الخاصة بها.
mt: Britain quickly blockaded Germany by sea after the skirmishes broke out. The strategy proved effective; cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, despite violating this blockade under general international law, which was codified and standardized in several international treaties during the last two centuries. Britain extended the international waters to prevent any ship from entering entire sections of the oceans, threatening even neutral ships. Because of a limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its own unrestricted submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

mt: 400,000 known cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. Multiple sclerosis is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Research has shown that the likelihood of women being affected by multiple sclerosis is twice that of men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: ووجدت الدراسة أن الاكتئاب، والخوف والكوارث يتوسطون العلاقة بين الألم والعجز لدى من يعانون من آلام أسفل الظهر. فقط آثار الكارثة، ولم يكن الاكتئاب والخوف شرطًا في جلسات نشاط بدني منتظمة أسبوعياً. احتاجت المجموعة المشاركة في نشاطٍ بدني منتظم إلى المزيد من الدعم فيما يتعلق بالتصور السلبي للألم لكي يتمكن أفرادها من التمييز بين الألم المزمن والشعور بعدم الراحة الناتج عن حركة بدنية عادية.
mt: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophizing mediate the relationship between pain and disability in those with low back pain. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression or fear, were required in weekly physical activity sessions. The participating group in regular physical activity needed more support in terms of negative pain beliefs to be able to distinguish between chronic pain and discomfort from normal physical activity.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

mt: Fencing is played on several levels, starting with students studying in the university and ending with professional and Olympic competitions. This sport is practiced in a system of duels, one fencer duels another.

src: التسمم الداخلي قد لا تظهر عوارضه فوراً. التشخيص الفوري لا يمكن بناؤه عند ظهور أعراض كالتقيؤ والتي هي عامة بشكل كافٍ. قد يكون أفضل مؤشر للتسمم الداخلي وجود حاوية مفتوحة للأدوية أو المواد الكيميائية المنزلية السامة. راجع الملصق للتعرف على إرشادات الإسعافات الأولية الخاصة بالسم المحدد.
mt: Internal poisoning may not show its effects immediately. Immediate diagnosis cannot be built when symptoms such as vomiting appear, which are generally sufficient. The best indicator of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of drugs or household toxic chemicals. Refer to the label for instructions on first aid for the specific poison.

The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: هناك الكثير من الآثار الاجتماعية والسياسية مثل استخدام النظام المتري، والتحول من الاستبداد إلى النظام الجمهوري، والقومية، والاعتقاد بأن البلاد ملك للشعب وليس للحاكم وحده. كما أنه من بعد الثورة، كانت المهن مفتوحةً لجميع المتقدّمين الذكور ممّا سمح للأكثر طموحاً ونجاحاً بالنجاح. الشيء نفسه ينطبق على الجيش لأنه بدلاً من أن تستند تصنيفات الجيش إلى الطبقة، فقد أصبحت الآن تعتمد على الأعيرة. لقد ألهمت الثورة الفرنسية أيضاً العديد من أبناء الطبقة العاملة المُضطهدة الآخرين في البلدان الأخرى لنزع فتيل ثوراتهم.
mt: There are many social and political consequences such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from autocracy to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the country belongs to the people, not just the ruler. After the revolution, professions were open to all qualified males, allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. The same applies to the army, which instead of being based on class, is now based on merit. The French Revolution also inspired many of the downtrodden working class in other countries to ignite their own revolutions.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: يشارك الجميع في المجتمع ويستخدمون أنظمة المواصلات. يشتكي الجميع من أنظمة المواصلات. نادراً ما تسمع في البلدان المتقدمة مستويات مماثلة من الشكاوى حول جودة المياه أو الجسور التي تسقط. ليش تولد أنظمة النقل مثل هذه الشكاوى، وليش تفشل بشكل يومي؟ هل مهندسو النقل غير أكفاء؟ أم أن هناك شيئاً أكثر جوهرية يحدث؟
mt: Everyone in the community uses and complains about the transportation system. Rarely do you hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges collapsing in developed countries. Why do transportation systems generate such complaints, and why do they fail daily? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more fundamental happening?

In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: حركة المرور هي دراسة حركة السائقين و المركبات الفردية بين نقطتين والتفاعلات التي يقومون بها مع بعضهم البعض. للأسف، دراسة حركة السير صعبة لأنه لا يمكن توقع سلوك السائق بيقين مائة في المئة. لحسن الحظ، يميل السائقون إلى التصرّف في نطاق معقول الاتساق؛ بهذا، تتمتع حركة المرور باتساق معقول، ويمكن التعبير عنها رياضيّاً بشكل تقريبي. ولتوضيح تدفق حركة المرور بشكل أفضل، أقيمت علاقات بين الخصائص الرئيسية الثلاثة: (1) التدفق و(2) الكثافة، و (3) السرعة. تساعد هذه العلاقات في تخطيط مرافق الطرق وتصميمها وتشغيلها.
mt: Traffic flow is a study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and their interactions with each other. Unfortunately, traffic flow is difficult to predict because drivers' behavior is not entirely predictable. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonable range of consistency; therefore, traffic flow is reasonably consistent, and can be expressed mathematically in a rough approximation. To better illustrate traffic flow, relationships were established between the three main properties: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning and designing road infrastructure and operating it.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: كانت تجربة هيرشي وتشيس واحدة من الدلائل الرئيسية على أن الحمض النووي مادة وراثية. استخدم هيرشي وتشيس العاثيات أو الفيروسات لإدخال الحمض النوويّ الخاصّ بهما إلى الجراثيم. قاموا بتجربتين لوسم إما حمض العاثيات النووي مستخدمين فوسفور مشع أو بروتينها بكبريت مشع.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the main pieces of evidence that DNA is a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages or viruses to introduce the DNA of the phages into bacteria. They performed two experiments either labeling the phage DNA with radioactive phosphorus or its protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: قد يكون للطفرات مجموعة متنوعة من الآثار المختلفة، على حسب نوع الطفرة، وأهميّة قطعة المادّة الوراثيّة المتأثّرة، وما إذا كانت الخلايا المتأثرة من خلايا الخط الجرثومي. يمكن فقط نقل الطفرات في خلايا الخط الجرثومي إلى الأطفال، بينما يمكن أن تسبب الطفرات في أماكن أخرى موت الخلايا أو السرطان.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of different effects, depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected piece of genetic material, and whether the affected cells are from a cancer cell line. Mutations in a cancer cell line can only be passed to children, while mutations in other places can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: يبدو أن الماعز قد دُجّن للمرة الأولى منذ ما يقرب من 10 آلاف عام في جبال زاغروس الإيرانية. بدأت الثقافات والقبائل القديمة في الاحتفاظ بها لسهولة الوصول إلى الحليب والصوف واللحوم والجلود. كانت الماعز الداجنة تُربى عموماً في قطعان تجولت على التلال أو مناطق الرعي الأخرى، وغالباً ما تُرعى بواسطة رعاة الماعز اللي كانوا في الغالب أطفالاً أو مراهقين، على غرار الراعي المعروف على نطاق واسع. ولا تزال طرق الرعي هذه مستخدمة حتى اليوم.
mt: Goats were domesticated for the first time in about 10,000 years in the Iranian Zagros Mountains. Early cultures and tribes began to keep them for the ease of access to milk, wool, meat, and hides. Domesticated goats were usually grazed in herds on hills or other grazing areas, and were often tended by goat herders who were usually children or teenagers, much like the herder known widely. These grazing methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: "الغولف لعبة يستخدم فيها اللاعبون العصيّ لضرب كرات في محاولةً لإدخالها في الثقوب. يتم لعب ثماني عشرة حفرةٍ خلال الجولة العادية، حيث يبدأ اللاعبون عادةً من أول حفرة في الملعب وينتهون في الثامنة عشرة. اللاعب الذي يقوم بأقل عدد من الضربات، أو التلويحات بالمضرب، لإكمال الدورة يفوز. تُمارَس اللعبة على العشب، ويُقصّ العشب المحيط بالحفرة وتُسمّى ""الخضراء""."
mt: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes on a course in as few strokes as possible. A round of golf consists of 18 holes, and players typically begin at the first hole and end at the eighteenth. The player who completes the course in the fewest strokes wins. The course is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut and called "the green".
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: "الغولف لعبة يستخدم فيها اللاعبون العصيّ لضرب كرات في محاولةً لإدخالها في الثقوب. يتم لعب ثماني عشرة حفرةٍ خلال الجولة العادية، حيث يبدأ اللاعبون عادةً من أول حفرة في الملعب وينتهون في الثامنة عشرة. اللاعب الذي يقوم بأقل عدد من الضربات، أو التلويحات بالمضرب، لإكمال الدورة يفوز. تُمارَس اللعبة على العشب، ويُقصّ العشب المحيط بالحفرة وتُسمّى ""الخضراء""."

The course is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut and called "the green".

src: الهدف الرئيسي للعلم هو معرفة الطريقة التي يعمل بها العالم من خلال منهجٍ علميٍ. هذه الطريقة في الواقع ترشد معظم البحث العلمي. وهي بالرغم من ذلك ليست متفردة في هذا الشأن، يعتبر التجريب والتجربة اختباراً يمكن استخدامه لتفنيد واحدة أو أكثر من الفرضيات المحتملة؛ طرح الأسئلة وإجراء الملاحظات يوجه البحث العلمي أيضاً.
mt: The scientific method is a powerful tool for understanding the world. It is not, however, the only one. Experiment and observation are used to test one or more hypotheses; asking questions and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: تضرب الأعاصير مساحة محدودة بالمقارنة بالعواصف الشديدة الأخرى، وبالرغم من ذلك، بإمكانها تدمير الأخضر واليابس في طريقها. يمكن للأعاصير أن تقتلع الأشجار من جذورها وتمزق الألواح من المباني وتقذف بالسيارات إلى السماء. تدوم أعنف 2% من الأعاصير لمدة تصل إلى أكثر من ثلاث ساعات. تصل سرعة هذه العواصف الوحشية إلى 480 كم/ساعة (133 م/ث؛ 300 ميل/س).

src: "كان محمد مهتمّاً بشدة بالأمور التي تتجاوز هذه الحياة الدنيويّة. اعتاد التردّد على غار أصبح يعرف بـ""حراء"" فوق جبل ""النور"" للتأمّل. يقدم الغار نفسه، الذي بقى على مر العصور، صورة حية للغاية عن ميول النبي محمد الروحية. يقع الكهف على قمة أحد الجبال شمال مكة، وهو معزول تماماً عن بقية العالم. وفي الحقيقة، فليس من السهل العثور عليه على الإطلاق حتى لو كنت تعلم بوجوده. فبمجرد الدخول إلى الكهف، تصبح في عزلةٍ تامةٍ. ولا شيء يمكن رؤيته غير السماء الصافية الجميلة فوق الجبال الكثيرة المحيطة. لا يمكن مشاهدة أو سماع سوى القليل جداً من هذا العالم داخل الكهف."
mt: "Mohammed was very interested in matters that transcend this worldly life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as "Hira" atop a mountain called "Nur" to contemplate. The cave itself, which has remained unchanged over the centuries, provides a very vivid picture of the Prophet Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. The cave is located on top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, and is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find it at all, even if you know it exists. As soon as you enter the cave, you are completely isolated. Nothing can be seen except the beautiful clear sky above the many mountains surrounding it. You can only see or hear very little of this world inside the cave."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: أُنشئت طرق العربات في إنجلترا في وقت يرجع إلى القرن السادس عشر. على الرغم من أن عربات السكك الحديدية القديمة كانت تتكون فقط من ألواحٍ خشبيةٍ متوازيةٍ، إلا أنها سمحت للخيول بسحبها لتحقيق سرعاتٍ أكبر وسحب أحمالٍ أكبر مقارنة بالطرق التي كانت تعتبر أكثر من وعرةٍ في ذلك التوقيت. تم اختراع قضبان القطارات في وقت مبكر نسبياً لتثبيت المسارات، ولكن اتضح بعد ذلك مع الوقت أن وضع شريط حديدي أعلى المسار يجعله أكثر فاعلية. وقد أصبح ذلك عرف متبع، إلا أن الحديد أدى إلى المزيد من التآكل للعجلات الخشبية للعربات. وفي النهاية، تم استبدال العجلات الخشبية بعجلات حديدية. في عام 1181ه، تم إدخال أول قضبان حديدية كاملة.
mt: Wagons were first built in England in the 16th century. Although early railway wagons were only made of parallel wooden boards, they allowed horses to pull them at higher speeds and haul larger loads than the roads, which were considered more rugged at that time. The invention of railway tracks early on to secure the rails, but it was later found that placing a steel strip above the track makes it more effective. This became a well-known fact, but steel led to more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. In 1181, the first complete steel rails were introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: كان للرومانسية عنصراً كبيراً من الحتمية الثقافية مستمدة من كتّاب مثل جوته وفيشت وشليغل. في سياق الحركة الرومانسية، شكلت الجغرافيا الأفراد، وبمرور الوقت نشأت العادات والثقافة المتصلة بتلك الجغرافيا، وكان هؤلاء، باعتبارهم في وئام مع مكان المجتمع، أفضل من القوانين المفروضة تعسفيًا.
mt: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism derived from writers such as Goethe, Vico and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography formed individuals, and over time, customs and culture associated with that geography developed, and those, as in harmony with the community, were better than arbitrary laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "الحتمية التكنولوجية هي مصطلح يشمل مجموعة واسعة من الأفكار في الممارسة، من دفع التكنولوجيا أو الضرورة التكنولوجية إلى الشعور الصارم بأن مصير الإنسان مدفوع بمنطق أساسي مرتبط بالقوانين العلمية ومظاهرها في التكنولوجيا. هناك فكرتان عامّتان مشترَكتان في معظمِ تفسيرات الحتميةِ التكنولوجيّة: أنّ تطوّر التّكنولوجيا نفسها يتبع مساراً إلى حدٍ كبيرٍ يتجاوز التّأثير الثّقافي أو السّياسي، وأن هذه التكنولوجيا بدورها لها ""تأثيراتٍ"" على المجتمعات المتأصّلة، بدلاً من المرتبطةِ بالمجتمع. على سبيل المثال، قد يقول المرء أن موتور السيارة يؤدي بالضرورة إلى تطوير الطرق. ولكن إنشاء شبكة طرق بامتداد البلاد ليس ذا جدوى اقتصادية لحفنة من السيارات، لذا يتم تطوير طرق جديدة لتقليل تكلفة ملكية سيارة. يؤدي الامتلاك الجماعي للسيارات أيضاً إلى ارتفاع معدل الحوادث على الطرق، مما يؤدي إلى ابتكار تقنيات جديدة في الرعاية الصحية لعلاج الأجسام المتضررة."
mt: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from pushing technology or technological necessity to a strong feeling that the fate of man is driven by a basic logic related to scientific laws and their manifestations in technology. There are two general ideas shared in most interpretations of technological determinism: that the development of technology itself follows a path to a large extent that transcends cultural or political influence, and that this technology itself has "effects" on societies, rather than being associated with society. For example, one might say that the automobile engine necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, the construction of a road network across the country is not economically viable for a handful of cars, so new roads are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Collective ownership of cars also leads to an increase in road accidents, leading to the development of new technologies in healthcare to treat damaged bodies.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "تبدو علامة ""الوتر لأعلى"" مثل حرف الـV وتبدو علامة ""الوتر لأسفل"" مثل الدباسة أو مربّع بدون الجانب السفلي منه. تفيد علامة أعلى بوجوب البدء من الطرف ودفع القوس، بينما تعني علامة أسفل وجوب البدء من نهاية القوس (حيث تمسك يدك بالقوس) وسحبه. يوّلد القوس العلوي في العادة صوتاً أكثر نعومة، بينما يكون القوس السفلي أقوى وأكثر حزماً. لا تتردد في رسم علاماتك الخاصة بالقلم الرصاص، ولكن تذكر أن العلامات المطبوعة المنحنية موجودة لسبب موسيقي، لذلك يجب احترامها عادة."
mt: "The up-bow looks like a V and the down-bow looks like a square without the bottom side. The up-bow indicates that you should start from the tip and push the bow, while the down-bow indicates that you should start from the end of the bow (where you hold the bow) and pull it. The up-bow usually produces a more gentle sound, while the down-bow is stronger and more forceful. Don't be afraid to draw your own bow marks with a pencil, but remember that printed bow marks are there for a musical reason, so they should be respected most of the time."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: على عكس الرئيسيات الأخرى، لم يَعد البشرُ يستخدمون أيديهم في الحركة أو تحمل الوزن أو التأرجح عبر الأشجار. تتشابه يد الشمبانزي وقدميه في الحجم والطول، وهو ما يعكس استخدام اليد لتحمل الوزن على المفصل عند المشي. اليد البشرية أقصر من القدم، مع عظام أكثر استقامة. كشفت عظام الأيدي بحفريّات تتراوح أعمارها بين مليوني وثلاثة ملايين عام عن هذا التحوّل في اختصاص اليد، من التنقّل إلى المناورة.
mt: Unlike other primates, humans no longer use their hands for locomotion or weight-bearing or swinging through trees. The chimpanzee hand and feet are similar in size and length, reflecting the use of the hand for weight-bearing at the joint when walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with more upright bones. The bones of the hands in fossils ranging in age from two million to three million years ago revealed this shift in the specialization of the hand, from movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: أوضحت أبحاث القرن العشرين وجود مجموعتين من التنوعات الچينية:- مجموعة مستترة وأخرى ظاهرة. تضيف الطفرة اختلافات وراثيّة جديدة، ويزيلها الانتقاء من تجميعة الاختلافات التعبيريّة. تعمل عمليتا الفصل وإعادة التركيب على جعل التباين عشوائياً ذهاباً وإياباً بين المجموعتين مع كل جيل.
mt: 20th century research showed two sets of Chinese variation: hidden and visible. The mutation adds new genetic differences, and selection removes the expressive differences. The sorting and recombination make the variation random between the two sets with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "في السافانا، يصعب على الرئيسيات التي لديها جهاز هضمي مشابه للبشر تلبية متطلباتها من الأحماض الأمينية من الموارد النباتية المتاحة. كما أن الفشل في فعل ذلك سيؤدي إلى عواقب وخيمة: اكتئاب النمو، ونقص التغذية، وفي النهاية الموت. وكانت الموارد النباتية التي يسهل الوصول إليها بكثرة هي البروتينات التي يمكن الحصول عليها من الأوراق والبقول، ولكن هذه البروتينات يصعب على الرئيسيات مثلنا هضمها ما لم يتم طهيها. وعلى النقيض، فإن الأطعمة الحيوانية (النمل والنمل الأبيض والبيض) ليست فقط سهلة الهضم، بل توفر بروتيناتٍ بكميات عالية وتحتوي على جميع الأحماض الأمينية الأساسية. عند أخذ كل الأشياء بعين الاعتبار، لا ينبغي لنا أن نندهش إذا قام أسلافنا بحل ""مشكلة البروتين"" لديهم بطريقة ما على نفس النحو اللي يقوم بها الشمبانزي في السافانا."
mt: "In the savanna, it is difficult for primates with a digestive system similar to ours to meet their requirements of amino acids from the available plant resources. And failure to do so will have dire consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The plant resources that are readily available in abundance are proteins that can be obtained from leaves and legumes, but these proteins are difficult for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. On the contrary, animal foods (ants, termites, and eggs) are not only easy to digest, but they provide high protein content and contain all the essential amino acids. Taking everything into account, we should not be surprised if our ancestors solved their "protein problem" in some way similar to how chimpanzees in the savanna do."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: تقوم الثّقافات الفرعيّة بالتّوفيق بين الأفراد المتشابهين في التفكير واللي يشعرون بالإهمال بسبب المعايير المجتمعيّة وتسمح لهم بتطوير الشعور بالهويّة. يحتمل أن تكون الثقافات الفرعية مُمَيِّزة بسبب العمر والعِرق والطبقة والموقع و/أو جنس الأعضاء. ربما تكون الصفات التي تحدد تميز ثقافة فرعية هي لغوية، أو جمالية، أو دينية، أو سياسية، أو جنسية، أو جغرافية، أو مجموعة من العوامل. يشير أعضاء الثقافات الفرعية إلى عضويتهم من خلال استخدام مختلف ورمزي للأسلوب اللي يتضمن الملابس، والسلوك، واللهجة.
mt: Subcultures reconcile individuals who think alike and feel marginalized by societal norms and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures may be distinguished by age, race, class, location, or gender. Members of subcultures indicate their membership through the use of various symbolic styles that include clothing, behavior, and dialect.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: يطور الأطفال وعياً من القوالب النمطية العرقية والعنصرية في عمر مبكر جداً وهذه القوالب النمطية العنصرية لها آثار على السلوك. على سبيل المثال، الأطفال المنتمون إلى أقلية عرقية تم وصمها بأنها لا تحقق نتائج جيدة في المدرسة يميلون إلى الأداء غير الجيد في المدرسة بمجرد معرفتهم بالصورة النمطية المرتبطة بعرقهم.
mt: Children develop racial and ethnic stereotypes at a very young age, and these stereotypes have behavioral consequences. For example, children from a racial minority who are labeled as not doing well in school are more likely to perform poorly in school once they know the stereotype associated with their race.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "ومن بين أكثر الطرق شيوعاً التي تستخدم لتوضيح أهمية التنشئة الاجتماعية، الاعتماد على الحالات القليلة المؤسفة للأطفال اللي عانوا من الإهمال أو سوء الحظ أو الإيذاء المتعمد، والغير مرتبطين اجتماعياً بالبالغين أثناء نشأتهم. ويطلق على هؤلاء الأطفال اسم ""المتوحش"" أو ال. تمّ حبسُ بعضِ الأطفال الضّالين من قبل أشخاصٍ (عادةً والديهم)؛ في بعضِ الحالات، كان التّخلي عن الطّفل بسبب رفض الوالدين لإعاقة الطّفل العقليّة أو الجسديّة الشديدة. ربما تعرض الأطفال المتخلفين إلى إساءة معاملة أثناء الطفولة أو صدمات شديدة قبل التخلي عنهم أو هروبهم. وآخرون يُزعم أنه تمت تربيتهم من قبل الحيوانات؛ فيما يقال أن البعض عاش في البرية لوحده. عندما تتم تربيته من قبل حيوانات غير بشرية، يظهر الطفل الوحشي سلوكيات (ضمن الحدود المادية) تشبه تماماً سلوكيات حيوان الرعاية الخاصة، مثل الخوف من البشر أو عدم الاكتراث بهم."
mt: "Among the most common ways to illustrate the importance of socialization is to rely on the few unfortunate children who were neglected or misfortunate or intentionally abused, and not socialized by adults during childhood. Some children were abandoned by people (usually their parents); in some cases, the child was relinquished because the parents refused to care for the child with severe mental or physical disabilities. Some of these children may have been abused during childhood or severely traumatized before being abandoned or running away. Others are said to have been raised by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild alone. When raised by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) that are indistinguishable from those of the animal's caretaking species, such as fear of humans or indifference to them."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: زراعةُ الكِفافِ هي الزّراعة التي يتمّ إجراؤها لإنتاجِ ما يكفي من الغذاء لتلبيةِ ما يحتاجه المزارعُ وعائلته فقط. تعتبر زراعة الكفاف -والتي غالباً ما تكون عضويةً- نظاماً بسيطاً تستخدم فيه البذور المخزّنة التي تتناسب والنظام البيئي للمنطقة، بالإضافة لأسلوب تناوب المحاصيل أو غيرها من التقنيات البسيطة نسبياً بهدف زيادة الناتج. عمل معظم المزارعين تاريخياً في زراعة الكفاف، ولا تزال هذه هي الحال في العديد من الدول النامية.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming done by a farmer to feed his or her family. Subsistence farming, which is often organic, uses stored seeds that fit the environment of the area, in addition to crop rotation or other simple techniques to increase yield. Most farmers historically worked in subsistence farming, and this is still the case in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: ولعلّ النوع الأكثر شيوعاً من السياحة هو ما يقرنه الأغلبية من الناس بالسفر: أي السياحة الترفيهية. يذهب السائحون في هذا النوع من السياحة إلى مكان مختلف جدًا عما اعتادوه في حياتهم اليومية بهدف الاسترخاء والاستمتاع. الشواطئ، وحدائق الملاهي، ومواقع التخييم هي أكثر الأماكن شيوعًا لمحبي السياحة الترفيهية. تُعرف السياحة الثقافية بأنها السياحة التي يكون فيها الهدف من زيارة أحد الأفراد إلى مكان معين هو التعرف على تاريخه وثقافته. ربما يرتاد السائحون مواقع سياحية متنوعة في بلد ما أو قد يفضلون التركيز على منطقة واحدة فحسب.
mt: The most common type of tourism is what most people think of when they think of travel: recreational tourism. Tourists in this type of tourism go to a place very different from what they are used to in their daily lives for relaxation and enjoyment. Beaches, amusement park gardens, and camping sites are the most common places for recreational tourists. Cultural tourism is known as tourism in which the purpose of visiting an individual to a particular place is to learn about its history and culture. Tourists may visit various tourist sites in a country or may prefer to focus on one area alone.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
